Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Class JSONFormat

java.lang.Object
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONFormat
public class JSONFormat extends Object

This class models all formatting options for JSON exporting. It allows for the adjustment of indent spaces and array and object newline settings.

Here are some things that I would like to add later:

  1. Number formatting

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static int
    ARRAY_BEGIN_ON_NEWLINE_BIT
    The bit in a JSON format code that if equal to 0 indicates that the opening square bracket [ in a JSON array should not be placed on a newline and if equal to 1 indicates that the opening square bracket [ should be placed on a newline.
    static int
    ARRAY_NEWLINE_PER_ITEM_BIT
    The bit in a JSON format code that if equal to 0 indicates that newlines should not be placed between each item in a JSON array and if equal to 1 indicates that newlines should be placed between each item.
    static int
    INDENT_SPACES_BITS
    The bits in a JSON format code that indicate the number of spaces
    static int
    OBJECT_BEGIN_ON_NEWLINE_BIT
    The bit in a JSON format code that if equal to 0 indicates that the opening curly brace { in a JSON object should not be placed on a newline and if equal to 1 indicates that the opening curly brace { should be placed on a newline.
    static int
    OBJECT_NEWLINE_PER_ITEM_BIT
    The bit in a JSON format code that if equal to 0 indicates that newlines should not be placed between each item in a JSON object and if equal to 1 indicates that newlines should be placed between each item.
    static int
    USE_TABS_BIT
    The bit in a JSON format code that if equal to 0 indicates that spaces should be used for indents and if equal to 1 indicates that tabs shold be used.

  • Method Details

    • getFormatCode

      public static int getFormatCode​(int indentSpacesCount, boolean useTabs, boolean arrayNewlinePerItem, boolean arrayBeginOnNewline, boolean objectNewlinePerItem, boolean objectBeginOnNewline)
      Generates a JSON format code with specified options.
      Parameters:
      indentSpacesCount - the number of spaces or tabs in indents, from 0 to 15
      useTabs - if true, use tabs instead of spaces in indents
      arrayNewlinePerItem - if true, include line breaks between array items
      arrayBeginOnNewline - if true, begin arrays on newlines
      objectNewlinePerItem - if true, include line breaks between object items
      objectBeginOnNewline - if true, begin objects on newlines
      Returns:
      the generated JSON format code, as an int

    • indentSpacesCount

      public static int indentSpacesCount​(int jsonFormat)
      Gets the number of indent spaces from a JSON format code.
      Parameters:
      jsonFormat - the JSON format code
      Returns:
      the int value of spaces

    • useTabs

      public static boolean useTabs​(int jsonFormat)
      Returns true if the JSON format code uses tabs and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      jsonFormat - the JSON format code
      Returns:
      true if the JSON format code uses tabs, false otherwise

    • arrayNewlinePerItem

      public static boolean arrayNewlinePerItem​(int jsonFormat)
      Returns true if the JSON format code uses newlines between array items and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      jsonFormat - the JSON format code
      Returns:
      true if the JSON format code uses newlines between array items, false otherwise

    • getIndentString

      public static String getIndentString​(int jsonFormat)
      Gets the indent string from a JSON format code. For example, if you put in a JSON format code with an indent spaces count of 6 and useTabs set to false, then this method would return a String with six spaces. These strings are all cached in the system for memory efficiency.
      Parameters:
      jsonFormat - the JSON format code
      Returns:
      the indent string
